body_html:
Sorry for this late reply.

No problem. I really appreciate what you're doing here. This is an important kernel, and it hasn't been loved as much as it deserves.

Compilation time is 5.6 seconds for float. [...] Binary size is 2MB. I hope these figures provide reassurance.

Thanks you. I think that should be fine. If the compilation time becomes a problem, it sounds like we could reasonably easily split it up into three files, one for each data type (i.e. float/half/double). But I also don't think it's necessary.

Thanks you.  I think that should be fine.  If the compilation time becomes a problem, it sounds like we could reasonably easily split it up into three files, one for each data type (i.e. float/half/double).  But I also don't think it's necessary.
body:
> Sorry for this late reply.

No problem.  I really appreciate what you're doing here.  This is an important kernel, and it hasn't been loved as much as it deserves.

> Compilation time is 5.6 seconds for float. [...] Binary size is 2MB. I hope these figures provide reassurance.

Thanks you.  I think that should be fine.  If the compilation time becomes a problem, it sounds like we could reasonably easily split it up into three files, one for each data type (i.e. float/half/double).  But I also don't think it's necessary.
